original: smras pa / ngag gi las las nyes pa ci zhig 'byung /
analyzed: smras pa / ngag gi las las nyes pa ci zhig 'byung /

analyzed: smras pa / gang mi smra /

analyzed: smras pa / 'dzin pa'i rtsa ba ci yin /

analyzed: smras pa / mngon par zhen pa ni rtsa ba'o //

analyzed: smras pa / mngon par zhen pa'i rtsa ba ci yin /

analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa ma yin pa kun btags pa ni rtsa ba'o //

analyzed: smras pa / lhag par mi dmigs pa ji lta bu /

analyzed: smras pa / gal te sred pa'i bag la nyal la lhag par mi dmigs pa ste /

original: zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros /

analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bdun pa'o ////

analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag @260b bo lag na rdo rje brang pa yongs su rdzogs par lung bstan pas dbugs phyin pa thob ste /

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la thugs brtse ba dang / sems can tshad med pa dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par spel ba @261a *//

translated: and in order to fulfill the wishes of the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, together with the bodhisattva mahāsattvas and the great hearers, went to the palace of the Lord of Secrets in the Veṇuvana, and consented to stay there for seven days.

analyzed: de nas yang 'di snyam du bsams te /
translated: Then he thought,

translated: “I have seen with my superknowledge

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du byang chub sems dpa' khri lung bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan mo mi nyal tsam na spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yon tan rin po che mtha' yas bkod pa zhes bya bar gshegs pa'i tshe /

analyzed: bkra ba blta na sdug pa yid du 'ong ba lus sim par byed pa /

original: rin po che'i padma bkod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i padma bkod pa dang ldan pa /

analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa / ci nas byang @268a *// chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / dri za dang / gsang ba pa dang /
translated: Then, in order to listen to the Dharma, Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi supplicated the Bhagavān:🔽“Bhagavān, please explain the way of entering the Dharma so that sentient beings who have not generated the mind of awakening will generate the mind of awakening, abide in irreversibility, and the retinue of yakṣas, rākṣasas, piśācas, gandharvas, guhyakas,

original: lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor 'di'i yun ring po'i don dang / sman pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyis khyad par du mngon du 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / nyams pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur bar de ltar chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor 'di'i yun ring po'i don dang / sman pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyis khyad par du mngon du 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / nyams pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur bar de ltar chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol /
translated: and mahoragas will have long-term benefit, well-being, accomplishment, happiness, and will become especially exalted, and will not have the quality of decline.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi and the entire retinue:

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends!

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang bshad par bya ste /🔽rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la zhugs na khyad par du mngon par 'phags par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang bshad par bya ste / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la zhugs na khyad par du mngon par 'phags par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep this in mind! I will explain it.

original: nyams pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi tshul khyod la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i chos can du mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi tshul khyod la bstan par bya'o //
translated: To any son or daughter of good family who enters this, I will teach the way of the Dharma so that they will become especially exalted🔽and will not become subject to degeneration.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: legs so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: legs so zhes gsol te /
translated: Excellent!”

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor des bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi and the entire retinue listened to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said to them:

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends!

original: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bsam pa @268b thag pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de dad pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bsam pa @268b thag pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de dad pa yin /
translated: “Here, noble sons and daughters who have developed the mind of awakening with a pure intention are faithful.

original: dad pa mang zhing 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa dang / ser sna med par gtong ba gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ste gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa'i ngang can dang /
analyzed: dad pa mang zhing 'phags pa rnams la lta 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa dang / ser sna med par gtong ba gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ste gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa'i ngang can dang /
translated: They have faith, wish to see the noble ones, wish to listen to the sublime Dharma, are generous without being stingy, enjoy being openhanded, and are inclined to make offerings.

original: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa 'byed pa la dga' ba dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / de las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang /
analyzed: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa 'byed pa la dga' ba dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / de las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang /
translated: They are perfect in giving, enjoy sharing, have a mind free from anger, have a mind free from turbidity, and have confidence in the ripening of karma.

original: mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / som nyi med la the tshom mi za zhing yid gnyis mi za ba yin /
analyzed: mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / som nyi med la the tshom mi za zhing yid gnyis mi za ba yin /
translated: They are interested, understand, and are free from doubt, hesitation, and uncertainty.”

original: de dkar po dang nag po'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar rig nas srog gi phyir yang mi bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: de dkar po dang nag po'i las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar rig nas srog gi phyir yang mi bya ba mi byed de /
translated: Knowing that the ripening of good and bad actions is not lost, he does not commit any nonvirtuous action even at the cost of his life.

original: de srog gcod pa spangs pa yin /
analyzed: de srog gcod pa spangs pa yin /
translated: He has given up killing.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba spangs pa yin te /
translated: He has given up taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: He does not focus on the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de dad par gyur nas dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: de dad par gyur nas dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Having faith, he attends on those who are virtuous,

original: bram ze gang dag yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang / dge ba'i chos can dang / mang du thos pa dang / thos pa la mngon par brtson pa dang /
analyzed: bram ze gang dag yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang / des pa dang / dge ba'i chos can dang / mang du thos pa dang / thos pa la mngon par brtson pa dang /
translated: on those who are renunciants or brahmins who are truly gone, truly entered, who have good conduct, good qualities, are gentle, have virtuous qualities, are learned, are dedicated to learning,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la rab tu brtson pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul @269a *//
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la rab tu brtson pa dang / zhi ba dang / dul @269a *//
translated: They are diligent in proper mental activity, and they are peaceful, disciplined, and tranquil.

original: ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / ngo bzlog phod par smra zhing bcam bur mi smra ba dang / dge ba'i bsam pa can dang / mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spong ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / ma khengs pa dang /
analyzed: ba dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / ngo bzlog phod par smra zhing bcam bur mi smra ba dang / dge ba'i bsam pa can dang / mi dge ba'i chos yongs su spong ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / ma khengs pa dang /
translated: They are able to speak in a way that is not offensive, and they do not speak in a way that is coarse. They have virtuous intentions, and they abandon unvirtuous qualities. They are not agitated, and they are not arrogant.

original: mu cor smra ba ma yin pa dang / tshig ma 'tshal ba dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / srid pa'i tshul bcad pa dang / zug rngu phyung ba dang / khur bor ba dang /
analyzed: mu cor smra ba ma yin pa dang / tshig ma 'tshal ba dang / dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / srid pa'i tshul bcad pa dang / zug rngu phyung ba dang / khur bor ba dang /
translated: They do not speak nonsense, and they do not speak in a way that is unclear. They are mindful, and they have minds that are utterly composed. They have cut through the way of existence, extracted the thorn, and put down their burden.

original: som nyi las nges par brgal ba dang / the tshom las brgal ba dang / yang srid pa las brgal ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: som nyi las nges par brgal ba dang / the tshom las brgal ba dang / yang srid pa las brgal ba 'di lta ste /
translated: They have crossed over doubt, crossed over uncertainty, and crossed over existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dge sbyong dang / bram ze dam pa de lta bu la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig nas bsten to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dge sbyong dang / bram ze dam pa de lta bu la dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig nas bsten to //
translated: and the disciples of the Tathāgata, the holy mendicants and brahmins.🔽

original: bsnyen to // bsnyen bkur byed do //🔽mnyes par byed cing mi mnyes par mi byed la /
analyzed: bsnyen to // bsnyen bkur byed do // mnyes par byed cing mi mnyes par mi byed la /
translated: He recognized the Tathāgatas and the Tathāgatas’ disciples, the holy mendicants and brahmins, as spiritual benefactors, and he followed them, served them, and attended them.🔽He pleased them and did not displease them.

original: dgyes par byed de /
analyzed: dgyes par byed de /
translated: He delighted them and did not enrage them.

original: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag mnyes par byas nas chos kyi gtam gyi yang dag par ston /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /
analyzed: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag mnyes par byas nas chos kyi gtam gyi yang dag par ston / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /
translated: Having pleased those spiritual benefactors, he listened to their Dharma teachings.🔽He took it up, remembered it,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: recited it, understood it,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad de /
translated: and delighted in it.

original: sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur bar yang dag par ston /
analyzed: sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur bar yang dag par ston /
translated: He taught generosity, which leads to great wealth,

original: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris su skye ba dang / thos pas ni shes rab chen por 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pas ni 'bral bar 'gyur ba yang dag par ston to //🔽'di ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris su skye ba dang / thos pas ni shes rab chen por 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pas ni 'bral bar 'gyur ba yang dag par ston to // 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: and he taught morality, which leads to rebirth in the higher realms, learning, which leads to great wisdom, and meditation, which leads to freedom.🔽This is generosity.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the maturation of generosity.

original: 'di ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser sna'o //
translated: This is stinginess.

original: 'di ni ser sna'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser sna'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of stinginess.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: This is morality.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of morality.

original: 'di @269b ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di @269b ni bzod pa'o //
translated: This is patience.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of patience.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: This is effort.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of effort.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan no //
translated: This is concentration.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of concentration.

original: 'di ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab bo //
translated: This is wisdom.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of wisdom.

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: This is bad wisdom.

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi rnam par smin pa'o //🔽'di ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi rnam par smin pa'o // 'di ni lus kyis legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the result of bad wisdom.🔽This is good conduct with the body.

original: 'di ni lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of good conduct with the body.

original: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'o //
translated: This is bad conduct with the body.

original: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the result of bad conduct with the body.

original: 'di ni ngag gis legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gis legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: This is good conduct with speech.

original: 'di ni ngag gis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of good verbal conduct.

original: 'di ni ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: This is bad verbal conduct.

original: 'di ni ngag gis nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gis nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of bad verbal conduct.

original: 'di ni yid kyis legs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyis legs par spyod pa'o //
translated: This is good mental conduct.

original: 'di ni yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyis legs par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of good mental conduct.

original: 'di ni yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: This is bad mental conduct.

original: 'di ni yid kyi nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyi nye bar spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: This is the ripening of bad mental conduct.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o //
translated: This is wholesome.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: This is unwholesome.

original: 'di ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba'o //
translated: This should be done.

original: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: This should not be done.

original: 'di ni byas na yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byas na yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba dang / grub pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do this, it will be for your long-term benefit, welfare, happiness, success, and well-being.

original: zhes de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gi chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par ston /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: zhes de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag gi chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par ston / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: In this way, those spiritual friends teach the Dharma discourse correctly,🔽encourage it,🔽praise it,

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and delight in it.

original: de nas de dag snod du rung bar mkhyen nas zab @270a *//
analyzed: de nas de dag snod du rung bar mkhyen nas zab @270a *//
translated: Then, knowing that they are suitable vessels,🔽

original: mo'i gtam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mo'i gtam 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, knowing that they were suitable vessels, he taught them this profound discourse:🔽the discourse on emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi gtam dang / mtshan ma med pa'i gtam dang / smon pa med pa'i gtam dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i gtam dang / ma skyes pa'i gtam dang / ma byung ba'i gtam dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gtam dang / mtshan ma med pa'i gtam dang / smon pa med pa'i gtam dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i gtam dang / ma skyes pa'i gtam dang / ma byung ba'i gtam dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang /
translated: the discourse on the absence of marks, the discourse on the absence of wishes, the discourse on the absence of conditioning, the discourse on non-arising, the discourse on non-occurrence, the discourse on selflessness, the discourse on the absence of sentient beings,

original: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i gtam rab tu ston to //
analyzed: srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i gtam rab tu ston to //
translated: the discourse on the absence of life-force, and the discourse on the absence of persons.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i gtam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo'i gtam 'di lta ste /
translated: He taught this profound discourse on dependent origination:

original: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di 'byung /
translated: “Because this exists, that comes to be.

original: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di mi 'byung /
analyzed: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di mi 'byung /
translated: Because this does not exist, that does not come to be.

original: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di skye /
analyzed: 'di yod pa'i phyir 'di skye /
translated: Because this exists, that arises.

original: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di 'gag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di 'gag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Because this does not exist, that ceases.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: Namely, conditioned by ignorance are the compositional factors.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: Conditioned by the compositional factors is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: Conditioned by consciousness is name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
translated: The condition of name and form is the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is contact.🔽The condition of contact is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: The condition of feeling is craving.🔽The condition of craving is grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: The condition of grasping is becoming.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: The condition of becoming is birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: The condition of birth is aging, death, grief, lamentation, suffering, mental anguish, and disturbance.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the arising of this entire great mass of suffering occurs.

original: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di mi 'byung /
analyzed: 'di med pa'i phyir 'di mi 'byung /
translated: If this does not exist, that does not occur.

original: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
analyzed: 'di 'gags pas 'di 'gag ste /
translated: From the cessation of this, that ceases.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /
translated: Thus, from the cessation of ignorance, conditioning ceases.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: From the cessation of conditioning, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags @270b pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags @270b pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
translated: From the cessation of consciousness, name and form cease.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: The cessation of name-and-form is the cessation of the six sense sources.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
translated: The cessation of the six sense sources is the cessation of contact.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
translated: The cessation of contact is the cessation of feeling.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
translated: The cessation of feeling is the cessation of craving.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
translated: The cessation of craving is the cessation of appropriation.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
translated: The cessation of appropriation is the cessation of existence.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
translated: The cessation of existence is the cessation of birth.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: The cessation of birth is the cessation of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro //🔽de la don dam par ni 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro // de la don dam par ni 'byung ba'am /
translated: In this way, this entire great mass of suffering ceases.

original: 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, however, there is no arising or cessation of any phenomenon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are dependently arisen.

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: They are without a master,

original: byed pa po med pa /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa /
translated: without an agent,

original: tshor ba po med pa /
analyzed: tshor ba po med pa /
translated: without a feeler,🔽and

original: rgyu dang / rkyen las byung ba'o //🔽'di la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen las byung ba'o // 'di la 'jug pa'am /
translated: It arises from causes and conditions.🔽There is no dharma here that engages or

original: ldog pa'am / rjes su 'jug pa'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: ldog pa'am / rjes su 'jug pa'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: disengages or follows.

original: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: Otherwise, the non-existent,

original: kun du gti mug pas khams gsum pa 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun du gti mug pas khams gsum pa 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: deluded designation of the three realms would occur.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / las kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / las kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'dogs pa 'byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the designation that follows affliction, follows karma, and follows suffering.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du gti mug pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na chos gang yang chos gang gi byed pa por 'gyur ba med de /🔽gang la byed pa po mi dmigs pa de la 'jug @271a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du gti mug pa de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na chos gang yang chos gang gi byed pa por 'gyur ba med de / gang la byed pa po mi dmigs pa de la 'jug @271a *//
translated: Moreover, that non-existent delusion, when thoroughly examined as it really is, is not the agent of any dharma.🔽Where the agent is not observed, there is no engagement and no disengagement.

original: pa med ldog pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa med ldog pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be said.

original: der chos zab mo'i gtam de lta bu thos nas som nyi med do //
analyzed: der chos zab mo'i gtam de lta bu thos nas som nyi med do //
translated: Having heard such a profound Dharma teaching there, one is without doubt.

original: the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi za'o //
translated: One is without hesitation.

original: chos thams cad la chags pa med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags pa med par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters into all phenomena without attachment.

original: de gzugs la mi chags so //
analyzed: de gzugs la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
analyzed: de mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to the eye, form, or eye consciousness.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind, to phenomena or mind consciousness.

original: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben par yid ches so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben par yid ches so //
translated: He has confidence that all phenomena are empty of inherent existence and that all phenomena are isolated by nature.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: de ltar dad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas mthong ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar dad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas mthong ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
translated: the bodhisattva who is established in faith does not fall away from seeing the Buddha,

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur byed pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: does not fall away from listening to the sublime Dharma, and does not fall away from serving the Saṅgha.

original: de gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever they are born, they will never be separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, and serving the Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyan sngar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi spyan sngar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born in the presence of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: der skyes nas kyang brtson 'grus brtsam par 'gyur /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang brtson 'grus brtsam par 'gyur /
translated: Having been born there, they will apply themselves with diligence.

original: dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal pa la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos yongs su btsal pa la mngon par brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be dedicated to seeking wholesome states.

original: de brtson 'grus brtsams pas khyim gyi gnas don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brtson 'grus brtsams pas khyim gyi gnas don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Through their diligence, they will not pursue a household life.

original: chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / @271b bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba yongs su 'dzin pas yongs su spyod pa don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / @271b bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba yongs su 'dzin pas yongs su spyod pa don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They will not pursue the enjoyment of taking a wife, sons, daughters, male and female servants, workers, and employees.

original: de na tshod gzhon nur rnam par rtse ba la mi dga' bas na tshod mdzes pa la bab pa'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pas khyim nas khyim med par myur tu rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de na tshod gzhon nur rnam par rtse ba la mi dga' bas na tshod mdzes pa la bab pa'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pas khyim nas khyim med par myur tu rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: He is not interested in the pleasures of youth, but when he reaches the age of beauty, he quickly goes forth from home into the homeless state, out of faith in the teachings of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de dad pas rab tu byung nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang / dge ba'i grogs po dge ba thob par byed pa rnams dang / dge ba'i bsam pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dad pas rab tu byung nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang / dge ba'i grogs po dge ba thob par byed pa rnams dang / dge ba'i bsam pa 'thob bo //
translated: Having gone forth out of faith, he associates with spiritual teachers, with spiritual friends who help him to acquire virtue, and he acquires a virtuous attitude.

original: de dge ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos rnams nyan to //
analyzed: de dge ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos rnams nyan to //
translated: Endowed with a virtuous attitude, he listens to the Dharma of the virtuous.

original: sgrub pa snying por byed kyi tshig lhur len pa'i blo dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa snying por byed kyi tshig lhur len pa'i blo dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He makes practice his essence, not mere verbal recitation.

original: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin te /
translated: He is diligent in seeking much learning,

original: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams kyang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis 'thob pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi re bar /
translated: and he teaches the Dharma as he has heard it, without concern for material possessions, honor, or fame.

original: gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la rgya cher yang dag par ston to //
translated: He teaches it extensively to others.

original: bdag gi tshig gi rjes su 'brang bar gzhan dag la chos mi ston to //
analyzed: bdag gi tshig gi rjes su 'brang bar gzhan dag la chos mi ston to //
translated: He does not teach the Dharma to others in order to follow their words.

original: de ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gzhan dag la chos ston to //
analyzed: de ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gzhan dag la chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to others as he has heard it and as he has understood it.

original: chos nyan pa rnams la ni byams pa chen po thob bo //
analyzed: chos nyan pa rnams la ni byams pa chen po thob bo //
translated: He has attained great love for those who listen to the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po bskyed do //
translated: He generates great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: de mang du thos par gyur pas lus dang / srog la mi lta ba yin /
analyzed: de mang du thos par gyur pas lus dang / srog la mi lta ba yin /
translated: He is one who has heard much, who does not care about body or life.

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / mgu sla ba dang / gso sla ba dang / dgon pa dang / bas mthar mngon par dga' ba yin /🔽ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams @272a *//
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / mgu sla ba dang / gso sla ba dang / dgon pa dang / bas mthar mngon par dga' ba yin / ji ltar thos pa'i chos rnams @272a *//
translated: He is one who has few desires, is content, secluded, easily satisfied, and delights in solitude and remote dwellings.

original: kyi don la yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi don la yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: He is one who thoroughly investigates the meaning of the Dharma as he has heard it.

original: don la rton pa yin te /
analyzed: don la rton pa yin te /
translated: He is one who relies on the meaning,

original: tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin no //
translated: not one who relies on the letter.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He will be the teacher of gods, humans, and demigods.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig gi phyir brtson pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig gi phyir brtson pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not strive for his own sake alone,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir /
translated: but for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: He seeks the unsurpassed Great Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol lo //
translated: which is the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: bag yod pa lhur len pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bag yod pa lhur len pa yang yin te /
translated: He is also one who is intent on heedfulness.

original: de la bag yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bag yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is heedfulness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dbang po sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa'o //
translated: Restraining the faculties.

original: de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: When he sees forms with his eyes, he does not grasp at signs and does not grasp at secondary characteristics.

original: de gzugs rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / 'byung ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de gzugs rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / 'byung ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows well the enjoyment of forms, their drawbacks, and their escape.

original: de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams dang / snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams dang / snas dri rnams dang / lces ro rnams dang / lus kyis reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, having heard sounds with the ear, smelled scents with the nose, tasted flavors with the tongue, felt touchable things with the body, and cognized mental phenomena with the mind, they do not grasp at signs and do not grasp at secondary marks.

original: chos rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / 'byung ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / 'byung ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: They know the experience of phenomena, their drawbacks, and their escape just as they are.

original: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called heedfulness.

original: gzhan yang bag yod pa ni gang rang gi sems 'dul ba dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / nyon mongs pa la dga' ba sel ba dang / chos la dga' ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dag /
analyzed: gzhan yang bag yod pa ni gang rang gi sems 'dul ba dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / nyon mongs pa la dga' ba sel ba dang / chos la dga' ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dag /
translated: “Moreover, heedfulness is taming one’s own mind, protecting the minds of others, eliminating delight in the afflictions, and engaging in delight in the Dharma.

original: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ba @272b med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu ba med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ba @272b med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu ba med pa dang /
translated: It is the absence of the activity of thoughts of desire, thoughts of malice, and thoughts of violence. It is the absence of the activity of the roots of nonvirtue: attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu ba med pa dang /
translated: It is the absence of the activity of physical misdeeds, the absence of the activity of verbal misdeeds, the absence of the activity of mental misdeeds, the absence of the activity of inappropriate attention,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu ba med pa ste /
translated: and the absence of the activity of all nonvirtuous, evil dharmas.

original: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called heedfulness.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: de ltar na bag yod par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bag yod par tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva who is diligent in heedful, proper attention is endowed with faith and heedfulness.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: dad pa mang ba dang / rtag tu mthun pa dang / chos don du gnyer ba dang / chos 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa mang ba dang / rtag tu mthun pa dang / chos don du gnyer ba dang / chos 'dod par bya'o //
translated: one should have much faith, always be in harmony, strive for the Dharma, and desire the Dharma.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: dad pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni 'jig rten pha rol tu ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni 'jig rten pha rol tu ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: a person who has faith is fearless in the world about the terrors of lower realms in the next world.

original: de'i sems nyes par spyod pa la mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i sems nyes par spyod pa la mi 'gro'o //
translated: Their mind does not go to bad conduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis bsngags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis bsngags par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be praised by the noble ones.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: gzhan yang chos spyod pa la gnas pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni chos dang ldan par 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos spyod pa la gnas pa'i skyes bu gang zag ni chos dang ldan par 'gro ba yin te /
translated: furthermore, a person who abides in Dharma conduct is endowed with Dharma and goes to the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas mthong ba rnams mnyes par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong ba rnams mnyes par byed do //
translated: They please the Buddhas they see.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas so //
translated: They abide in the noble path.

original: che ba nyid kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: che ba nyid kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain greatness.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: che ba nyid thob nas che ba nyid 'di lta ste /
analyzed: che ba nyid thob nas che ba nyid 'di lta ste /
translated: having attained greatness, this greatness is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: You should perfect the mind of awakening, which leads to the attainment of the wisdom of the thus-gone ones.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: gzhan yang bde ba thob par 'dod pa'i skyes bu gang zag gis shin @273a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba thob par 'dod pa'i skyes bu gang zag gis shin @273a *//
translated: furthermore, a person who wishes to attain happiness

original: tu grub pa dang / bde ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: tu grub pa dang / bde ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: should strive for the ultimate and blissful transcendence of suffering.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'ongs pa'i 'khor 'di ji ltar lhang nge ba la ltos /
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis 'ongs pa'i 'khor 'di ji ltar lhang nge ba la ltos /
translated: look at how radiant this retinue is, which has come here due to its past roots of virtue.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir shin tu brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir shin tu brtson par bya'o //
translated: in order to prevent the roots of virtue from declining, you should strive with utmost diligence.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the roots of virtue be prevented from declining?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: bag yod par gnas pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag yod par gnas pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the gods and humans who abide carefully will not let their roots of virtue decline.

original: de la bag yod pa ni sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / yul 'dor ba dang / 'dod pa la dga' ba rnam par spong ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba la bsten pa dang / 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: de la bag yod pa ni sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / yul 'dor ba dang / 'dod pa la dga' ba rnam par spong ba dang / chos kyi dga' ba la bsten pa dang / 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: “Here, conscientiousness is the protection of the mind, the abandonment of objects, the complete abandonment of delight in desire, the reliance on the delight of the Dharma, and the absence of the activity of thoughts of desire, thoughts of malice, and thoughts of violence.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnams dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / mi dge ba'i rnams dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang /
translated: It is the absence of the activity of nonvirtue and improper mental activity, the absence of the activity of attachment, aversion, and delusion,

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa nas nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar gyi rgyu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa nas nyams pa'i cha dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad kyi bar gyi rgyu ba med pa ste /
translated: and the absence of the activity of the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind, up to the absence of the activity of all phenomena that lead to degeneration.

original: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called conscientiousness.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: su dad pa dang ldan @273b zhing bag yod pa dang ldan pa des brtson 'grus gang gis bag yod par byed pa dang / dad par byed pa'i chos de dag yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: su dad pa dang ldan @273b zhing bag yod pa dang ldan pa des brtson 'grus gang gis bag yod par byed pa dang / dad par byed pa'i chos de dag yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Whoever is endowed with faith and heedfulness should be endowed with diligence, by which one becomes heedful and faithful, and by which one accomplishes those dharmas that make one heedful and faithful.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: su dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa des dran pa dang shes bzhin la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: su dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa des dran pa dang shes bzhin la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Whoever is endowed with faith, heedfulness, and diligence should strive in mindfulness and introspection.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin des byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad chung za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin des byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad chung za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By that mindfulness and introspection, all the dharmas of the factors of awakening will not be lost.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: su dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa des tshul bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: su dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa des tshul bzhin du sbyor ba la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Whoever is endowed with faith, heedfulness, diligence, mindfulness, and introspection should strive in proper application.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: tshul bzhin sbyor ba la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang yod pa de yang yod par rab tu shes so; ;gang med pa de yang med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin sbyor ba la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang yod pa de yang yod par rab tu shes so; ;gang med pa de yang med par rab tu shes so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is intent on proper application knows what exists as existent and what does not exist as nonexistent.

original: de la yod pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la yod pa ni gang /
translated: What is it that exists?

original: med pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: med pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that does not exist?

original: yang dag par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la ni 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba yod do //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la ni 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba yod do //
translated: The noble liberation exists for one who is endowed with proper application.

original: 'di ni yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is said to be what exists.

original: de la med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that does not exist?

original: log par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la ni 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba med de /
analyzed: log par sbyor ba dang ldan pa la ni 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba med de /
translated: The noble liberation does not exist for one who is endowed with improper application.

original: de ni med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is said to be what does not exist.

original: gzhan yang las dang / rnam par smin pa ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang las dang / rnam par smin pa ni yod do //
translated: Moreover, action and its ripening exist.

original: gang las de dang rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa de ni med do //
analyzed: gang las de dang rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa de ni med do //
translated: But one who is endowed with action and its ripening does not exist.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob tu mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob tu mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yod do //
translated: Moreover, eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind exist superficially.

original: @274a *// gang mig nas yid kyi bar dang ldan pa ni med do //
analyzed: @274a *// gang mig nas yid kyi bar dang ldan pa ni med do //
translated: But one who is endowed with eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind does not exist.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa la ni byang chub yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtsams pa la ni byang chub yod do //
translated: Moreover, enlightenment exists for the bodhisattva who has begun striving.

original: le lo can la ni byang chub med do //
analyzed: le lo can la ni byang chub med do //
translated: Enlightenment does not exist for the lazy.

original: phyin ci log las byung ba'i phung po lnga dag ni yod do //
analyzed: phyin ci log las byung ba'i phung po lnga dag ni yod do //
translated: The five aggregates that have arisen from error exist.

original: rgyu med pa las chos 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las chos 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: A dharma that arises without a cause does not exist.

original: gzhan yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi gzugs ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi gzugs ni yod do //
translated: Moreover, form that is impermanent, painful, and subject to change exists.

original: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag par de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i gzugs de ni med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag par de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i gzugs de ni med do //
translated: Form that is permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, and that abides as just that true reality does not exist.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni yod do //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are impermanent, painful, and subject to change exist.

original: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag par de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag par de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni med do //
translated: There is no consciousness that is permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, and that endures as it really is.

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de dag ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de dag ni yod do //
translated: “‘The conditions of ignorance and volitions do exist.

original: ma rig pa med na 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de dag med do //
analyzed: ma rig pa med na 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de dag med do //
translated: If there were no ignorance, there would be no volitions.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The conditions of volitions and consciousness do exist.

original: 'du byed rnams med na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni med do //
translated: If there were no volitions, there would be no consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The conditions of consciousness and name-and-form do exist.

original: rnam par shes pa med na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba de ni med @274b do; ;ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba de ni med @274b do; ;ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: If there were no consciousness, there would be no name-and-form. The conditions of name-and-form and the six sense sources do exist.

original: ming dang gzugs med na skye mched drug ces bya ba de med do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs med na skye mched drug ces bya ba de med do //
translated: If name-and-form does not exist, what is called the six sense spheres does not exist.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres for contact exists.

original: skye mched drug med na reg pa zhes bya ba de med do //
analyzed: skye mched drug med na reg pa zhes bya ba de med do //
translated: If the six sense spheres do not exist, contact does not exist.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The condition of contact for feeling exists.

original: reg pa med na tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni med do //
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor ba zhes bya ba de ni med do //
translated: If contact does not exist, feeling does not exist.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba de yin yod do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba de yin yod do //
translated: The condition of feeling for craving exists.

original: tshor ba med na sred pa zhes bya ba de med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med na sred pa zhes bya ba de med do //
translated: If feeling does not exist, craving does not exist.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The condition of craving for clinging exists.

original: sred pa med na len pa zhes bya ba de med do //
analyzed: sred pa med na len pa zhes bya ba de med do //
translated: If craving does not exist, clinging does not exist.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The condition of clinging for existence exists.

original: len pa med na srid pa zhes bya ba de med do //
analyzed: len pa med na srid pa zhes bya ba de med do //
translated: If clinging does not exist, existence does not exist.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba de ni yod do //
translated: The condition of existence for birth exists.

original: srid pa med na skye ba zhes bya ba de ni med do; ;skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams ni yod do //
analyzed: srid pa med na skye ba zhes bya ba de ni med do; ;skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams ni yod do //
translated: If there is no becoming, then what is called birth does not exist.🔽With birth as a condition, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress come into being.

original: skye ba med na rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams med do //
analyzed: skye ba med na rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams med do //
translated: If there is no birth, then aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, despair, and distress do not exist.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni yod do //
translated: “Moreover, it is true that through generosity one will have great wealth.

original: sbyin pas dbul por 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: sbyin pas dbul por 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: It is not true that through generosity one will become poor.

original: tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni yod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni yod do //
translated: It is true that through moral discipline one will be reborn in a good realm.

original: tshul khrims kyis ngan song du skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ngan song du skye ba ni med do //
translated: It is not true that through moral discipline one will be reborn in a bad realm.

original: thos pas shes rab chen por 'gyur ba ni yod do //
analyzed: thos pas shes rab chen por 'gyur ba ni yod do //
translated: It is true that through learning one will have great wisdom.

original: @275a *// thos pas shes rab 'chal bar 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: @275a *// thos pas shes rab 'chal bar 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: It is not true that through learning one will have little wisdom.

original: bsgoms pas 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bsgoms pas 'bral bar 'gyur ba ni yod do //
translated: It is true that through meditation one will be free.

original: bsgoms pas 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ni med do //🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan na /
analyzed: bsgoms pas 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ni med do // tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan na /
translated: There is no meditation that does not lead to separation.

original: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni yod do //
translated: There is the arising of afflictions when there is improper mental activity.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bral na nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bral na nyon mongs pa 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: There is no arising of afflictions when there is freedom from improper mental activity.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa med do //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can la ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa med do //
translated: There is no imparting of knowledge to those who are arrogant.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la ni mya ngan las 'das pa yod do //
translated: There is nirvāṇa for those who are free of arrogance.

original: gzhan yang thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i stong pa nyid ni yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i stong pa nyid ni yod do //
translated: Moreover, there is emptiness that extends to everything.

original: nang gi rjes su song ba'i bdag ni med do //
analyzed: nang gi rjes su song ba'i bdag ni med do //
translated: There is no self that extends to the inner.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa la ni thar pa yod do //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa la ni thar pa yod do //
translated: There is liberation for those who have wisdom.

original: nga rgyal dang ldan pa la ni 'byung ba med do //🔽bdag gam / sems can nam /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ldan pa la ni 'byung ba med do // bdag gam / sems can nam /
translated: There is no arising for those who are arrogant.🔽There is no self, no sentient being,

original: srog gam / gang zag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni med do //
analyzed: srog gam / gang zag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni med do //
translated: no life-force, and no person.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: de ltar na bag yod pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams la yod par grags pa gang yin pa de ni yod par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na bag yod pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams la yod par grags pa gang yin pa de ni yod par rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is endowed with carefulness and proper mental activity knows what exists to exist, in accordance with what is accepted by the wise in the world.

original: 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams la med par grags pa gang yin pa de ni med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na mkhas pa rnams la med par grags pa gang yin pa de ni med par rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows what does not exist to not exist, in accordance with what is accepted by the wise in the world.

original: de yod do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa la yang mi chags so //
analyzed: de yod do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa la yang mi chags so //
translated: He is not attached to the designation of existence.

original: med do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa la yang mi chags te /
analyzed: med do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa la yang mi chags te /
translated: He is not attached to the designation of non-existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom @275b ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa yang dag pa'i don rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom @275b ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa yang dag pa'i don rjes su rtogs so //
translated: He realizes the true meaning taught by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Secrets,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mdor bsdus te /
translated: the Tathāgata, having summarized all dharmas,

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi rnam par bzhag go /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi rnam par bzhag go /
translated: has set forth four summaries of the Dharma.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rtag par smra ba rnams dang / lha tshe ring po rtag par 'du shes pa rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / lha dang mi bde bar 'du shes pa rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze rtag par smra ba rnams dang / lha tshe ring po rtag par 'du shes pa rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / lha dang mi bde bar 'du shes pa rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang /
translated: In order to destroy the ascetics and brahmins who propound eternalism, the gods who have the perception of eternal life, and the gods who have the perception of happiness in the realms of gods and humans, he taught, All formations are impermanent, All formations are suffering, and All phenomena are nonself.

original: mu stegs can bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir chos thams cad la bdag med do zhes bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams kyi gzhom pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to destroy the tīrthikas who propound the self, he taught, All phenomena are nonself, and in order to destroy those who are proud of their conceptual practices, he taught, Nirvāṇa is peace.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: Guhyapati,

original: mi rtag ces bya ba de ni shin tu mi rtag pa'i don gyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba de ni shin tu mi rtag pa'i don gyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: impermanent is a term that refers to the meaning of complete impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de ni smon pa dang bral ba'i tshig bla dvags so; ;bdag med ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba de ni smon pa dang bral ba'i tshig bla dvags so; ;bdag med ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: Suffering is a term for freedom from desire.🔽Selflessness is a term for the characteristic of emptiness.🔽Nirvana is peace is a term for the realization of signlessness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba de ni mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'i tshig bla dvags so; ;gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba de ni mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba'i tshig bla dvags so; ;gsang ba pa'i bdag po /

translated: It is to connect with the three realms, to eliminate, to gather, to increase the roots of virtue, to be skilled in discipline, to know how to gather, and to be skilled in accumulating all that is virtuous.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la yang mkhas pa dang / chos thams cad dben par yang shes la dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la yang mkhas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin du yang shes la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la yang mkhas pa dang /

translated: It is to know exhaustion and to be skilled in the inexhaustible accumulation of merit, to realize the absence of arising and to be skilled in intentional rebirth, to have no sentient beings and to be skilled in ripening sentient beings, to know that all phenomena are void and to be skilled in upholding the sublime Dharma, to know that all buddha realms are of the nature of space and to be skilled in purifying a buddha realm,

translated: They know that all buddhas are the dharmakāya, and they are skilled in seeking the adornments of the major and minor marks. They know that there is no formation, and they are skilled in not interrupting the continuity of the formation of all roots of virtue.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos kyang yongs su sbyong la don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi ci bya'o cog la yang mkhas la lus dang sems dben par dga' ba yang shes pa dang / chos bstan pa yang mi 'dor la smra ba la smad pa la mkhas pa dang /

translated: They purify conditioned phenomena and they have few goals and few activities. They are skilled in everything that all beings need to do, and they know the joy of the solitude of body and mind. They do not abandon teaching the Dharma, and they are skilled in despising speech.

original: bsam gtan yang bskyed @287a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan yang bskyed @287a *//
translated: They generate meditative concentration,
